review_blob: The aroma was very rosty with hints of chocolate and coffee. The beer poars black with a thick brown head. The aftertaste is sweet with little to no bitterness. The beer has a thick oily body that I found very nice with.

Aroma: Really rich floral and citrus hop smell. Also a little boozy.

Appearance: beautiful red to amber hue. Thick head which left plenty of webs. 

Taste: surprisingly easy to drink for an Imperial red. 

Palate: Sticky Mouthfeel with a head that was thick and delicious. 

Overall: I can see why this is such a favorite among beer drinkers. A great easy to drink robust beer. an instant favorite in my opinion.

Aroma: Floral and Citrus notes are immediately apparent.

Appearance, The beer is pale and cloudy. Very thin head thats mostly white. 

Taste: medium bitterness but otherwise very crisp

Palate: light and easy to drink. perfect for a summer day. 

Overall: One of my favorite beers for the summer and one I can regularly find on tap due to my proximity to the brewery.

Aroma: Coffee notes are foremost as one would expect from a coffee infused beer. slight notes of citrus from hops

Appearance: Not much to write home about in terms of appearance dark with a good thick head that dissipates quickley

Taste: The front tast of the beer is citrusy from the hops the malt finish then tastes very much of hops. these two flavors do not combine well. 

Palate. The beer is a lot thinner then I expected slightly thicker than that of an iced coffee

Overall: A coffee infused beer is a great idea but would be better done with a stout or porter then a brown ale.

Aroma: This beer offers little for aroma. Very little of the hop aroma comes through although a great deal of the malts do offering a subtle carmel/roasty notes.

Apperance: The beer is brow but not opaque it pours with a good tan head

Taste. Despite being a Brown Ale this has a fairly light feel to it. Much of flavor comes from the malts which offer a Chocalatey/Malty flavor to it. 

Palate: The beer has a very smooth medium mouth feel. While not a sessionable beer it does drink very easily. 

Overall: My Favorite Brown Ale Ive tried so far. Although Im not a huge fan of the style I can see myself buying this beer plenty more times.
